alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:25PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Oneida, northwestern Bannock, Power and southwestern Bingham Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pingree to American Falls Reservoir to near Neeley. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, wind gusts to 40 mph, pea sized hail, and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, American Falls, Neeley, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Aberdeen, Rockland, Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Portneuf Gap, Fort Hall Townsite, Springfield, Fort Hall Mount Putnam, Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge, Pingree, Pocatello Airport, Fort Hall Putnam Lodge, Sterling, Pauline and Massacre Rocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
